wikipedia_page.main: Eryl Margaret McNally (born 11 April 1942) is a former Labour Member of the European Parliament (MEP) for the East of England constituency.

response: In June 1994, she contested the European Parliament seat of Bedfordshire and Milton Keynes, but lost the seat to Labour's Eryl McNally by 94,837 votes to 61,628 votes. After fourteen years as a member of the House of Commons, Currie like many other Tory MPs, lost her parliamentary seat of South Derbyshire in the 1997 general election.

response: His daughter, Eryl McNally, was a Labour Member of the European Parliament  between 1994 and 2004.
Past chairs include Brian White, Eryl McNally and Professor John Chesshire.
